Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2008 11:43AM Debsky wrote: Hi, I am in similar shoes to Maggie, although I have more risk factors.  I'm 56 years old.  My breasts were radiated when I was 18 for treatment of keiloids.  My sister has had breast cancer twice in the same breast.  Second occurance which was a different type of cancer was diagnosed as Stage IV.  I've had 7 tumors removed over the years and all were benign fibroidadenomas.  This one is different though.  Larger and more painful.  It's in the inner bottom of my breast.  I've been told that most BC's are in the top and or outer breast.  My biopsy isn't until April 15th.  I'm scared to death! Deb
Posts.Title: Dr found lump MaggieTheArtist anniee
